adverbs.description: coercibly (comparative more coercibly, superlative most coercibly)

entries.meaning: (uncommon, possibly erroneous) Coercively; in a way that is coercive; by coercion.
examples: I would sooner consider that a cult since my taxes are coercibly taken from me, while my contributions to the ICC are voluntary.

entries.meaning: (rare, possibly erroneous) As a result of coercion; having been coerced; in a coerced manner.
examples: Industry will meet this obligation either voluntarily or coercibly through taxes.
